item.title: Online retailing is becoming increasingly popular for smartphones in China
item.description:
Want to expand your customer base? Consider partnering with an e-mall, especially in China. A recent IDC Mobile Phone Tracker report indicates a rise in the share of e-tailers, like JD, Alibaba’s Tmall, and Suning Yigou, in China’s smartphone market, from 14% in Q2 2014 to 21% in Q2 2015. This translates to a 58% year-on-year surge in the number of smartphones sold via these online platforms. Tay Xiaohan, a Senior Market Analyst at IDC Asia/Pacific’s Client Devices team, highlights that as operators scale back smartphone subsidies, vendors find more opportunities in the open market, with e-tailers emerging as a crucial channel...

item.description:

IDC reports that smartphones constitute over 80% of China’s total phone sales. item.description:
